Definition: Indicate whether the patient had an operative mortality:  Includes both (1) all deaths occurring during the acute episode of care  in which the operation was performed (this includes patients transferred to other acute care facilities), even if after 30 days; and (2) those deaths occurring after discharge from the hospital, but within 30 days of the procedure unless the cause of death is clearly unrelated to the operation.
Indicate the date the patient was declared dead.
Indicate the patient's location at time of death.
HarvestCodes: [{"Description":"Operating Room (OR)  During Initial Surgery","HarvestCode":"1"},{"Description":"Hospital (Other Than Operating Room)","HarvestCode":"2"},{"Description":"Home","HarvestCode":"3"},{"Description":"Extended Care Facility","HarvestCode":"7"},{"Description":"Hospice","HarvestCode":"8"},{"Description":"Acute Rehabilitation","HarvestCode":"9"},{"Description":"Operating Room (OR) During Reoperation","HarvestCode":"5"},{"Description":"Unknown","HarvestCode":"6"},{"Description":"Other","HarvestCode":"10"}]

Definition: Indicate the PRIMARY cause of death, i.e., the first significant abnormal event which ultimately led to death.
Indicate whether or not the patient was discharged from facility on ADP Inhibitors.
Indicate whether or not the patient was discharged from facility on antiarrhythmics.
Indicate the name of the antiarrhythmic medication the patient was on when discharged from the facility.

Indicate whether or not the patient was discharged from facility on Aspirin, or if it was contraindicated. The contraindication must be documented in the medical record by a physician, nurse practitioner, or physician assistant.

Indicate whether or not the patient was discharged from facility on ACE or ARB Inhibitors, or if it was contraindicated or not indicated.  The contraindication must be documented in the medical record by a physician, nurse practitioner, or physician assistant.

Indicate whether or not the patient was discharged on beta blockers, or if beta blocker was contraindicated or not indicated.  The contraindication must be documented in the medical record by a physician, nurse practitioner, or physician assistant.

Indicate whether or not the patient was discharged on a statin or lipid lowering medication, or if it was contraindicated or not indicated. The contraindication must be documented in the medical record by a physician, nurse practitioner, or physician assistant.
Indicate the type of Lipid Lowering medication the patient was on when discharged from the facility.
Indicate whether the patient was discharged from the facility on Coumadin.
Indicate whether the patient was discharged from the facility on a direct thrombin inhibitor.
Indicate the location to where the patient was discharged.

Indicate whether advice was given or discussion conducted with the patient (by physician, nurse, or other personnel) regarding the importance of joining a cardiac rehabilitation program, or an appointment made.

Indicate whether, prior to discharge from the acute care facility, the patient received smoking cessation counseling.  Please select "Not Applicable" for those patients with no prior history of smoking or remote (more than 1 year) history.

Indicate whether the patient was readmitted to an acute care facility as an in-patient within 30 days from the date of initial surgery for ANY reason.  This includes readmissions to acute care, primary care institutions only.  Do not include readmissions to rehabilitation hospital, or nursing home.
Indicate the primary reason that the patient was readmitted as an in-patient within 30 days from the date of initial surgery.

Definition: Indicate the primary procedure that the patient received after being readmitted as an in-patient within 30 days from the date of initial surgery.

Definition: The version number of the set of coefficients used in the risk models to calculate the risk scores for this record.  The value is inserted into the record at the time the risk calculations are performed.  The version numbers will be specified by the STS.
Indicate the Predicted Risk of Mortality.
Indicate the Predicted Risk of Deep Sternal Wound Infection.
Indicate the Predicted Risk of Reoperation.
Indicate the Predicted Risk of Permanent Stroke.
Indicate the Predicted Risk of Prolonged Ventilation.
Indicate the Predicted Risk of Renal Failure.
Indicate the Predicted Risk of Morbidity or Mortality.
Indicate the Predicted Risk of Short Length of Stay.
Indicate the Predicted Risk of Long Length of Stay.
